chk 0.0.1.9023
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Benchmarking chk
  • Changelog

Check Type

Source: R/chk-type.R
chk_type.Rd

Checks if is a particular type of object.

chk_s3_class(x, class, x_name = NULL)

vld_s3_class(x, class)

chk_s4_class(x, class, x_name = NULL)

vld_s4_class(x, class)

chk_whole_numeric(x, x_name = NULL)

vld_whole_numeric(x)

chk_list(x, x_name = NULL)

vld_list(x)

chk_function(x, x_name = NULL)

vld_function(x)

chk_vector(x, x_name = NULL)

vld_vector(x)

chk_scalar(x, x_name = NULL)

vld_scalar(x)

Arguments

x

The object to check.
class

A string specifying the class.
x_name

A string of the name of object x or NULL.

Value

The chk_ functions throw an informative error if the test fails. The vld_ functions return a flag indicating whether the test was met.

Functions

  • chk_s3_class: Check Inherits from S3 Class

    Checks inherits from S3 class using

    !isS4(x) && inherits(x, class)

    Class should be a string.

  • vld_s3_class: Validate Inherits from S3 Class

    Validates inherits from S3 class

    !isS4(x) && inherits(x, class)

    Class should be a string.

  • chk_s4_class: Check Inherits from S4 Class

    Checks inherits from S4 class using

    isS4(x) && inherits(x, class)

    Class should be a string.

  • vld_s4_class: Validate Inherits from S4 Class

    Validates inherits from S4 class

    isS4(x) && inherits(x, class)

    Class should be a string.

  • chk_whole_numeric: Check Whole Numeric

    Checks if integer vector or double equivalent using vld_whole_numeric().

    The chk_whole_number() function checks if non-missing integer scalar or double equivalent.

  • vld_whole_numeric: Validate Whole Numeric

    Validates integer vector or double equivalent using

    is.integer(x) || (is.double(x) && vld_true(all.equal(x, as.integer(x))))

  • chk_list: Check List

    Checks if is a list using vld_list().

  • vld_list: Validate List

    Validates is a list using

    is.list(x)

  • chk_function: Check Function

    Checks if is a function using vld_function().

  • vld_function: Validate Function

    Validates is a function using:

    is.function(x)

  • chk_vector: Check Vector

    Checks if is a vector using is.vector().

  • vld_vector: Validate Vector

    Validates is a vector using:

    is.vector(x)

  • chk_scalar: Check Scalar

    Checks if is a vector using length(x) == 1L.

  • vld_scalar: Validate Scalar

    Validates is length(x) == 1L.

Examples


# chk_s3_class
chk_s3_class(1, "numeric")
try(chk_s3_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation"))
#> Error : `getClass("MethodDefinition")` must inherit from S3 class 'classRepresentation'.
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>   3. │   ├─base:::tryCatchOne(...)
#>   4. │   │ └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   5. │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>   7. │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>   9. ├─base::saveRDS(...)
#>  10. ├─base::do.call(...)
#>  11. ├─(function (what, args, quote = FALSE, envir = parent.frame()) ...
#>  12. └─(function (..., crayon_enabled, crayon_colors, pkgdown_internet) ...
#>  13.   └─pkgdown::build_site(...)
#>  14.     └─pkgdown:::build_site_local(...)
#>  15.       └─pkgdown::build_reference(...)
#>  16.         └─purrr::map(...)
#>  17.           └─pkgdown:::.f(.x[[i]], ...)
#>  18.             └─pkgdown:::data_reference_topic(...)
#>  19.               └─pkgdown:::run_examples(...)
#>  20.                 └─pkgdown:::highlight_examples(code, topic, env = env)
#>  21.                   └─evaluate::evaluate(x, child_env(env), new_device = TRUE)
#>  22.                     └─evaluate:::evaluate_call(...)
#>  23.                       ├─evaluate:::timing_fn(...)
#>  24.                       ├─evaluate:::handle(...)
#>  25.                       │ └─base::try(f, silent = TRUE)
#>  26.                       │   └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  27.                       │     └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  28.                       │       └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  29.                       │         └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  30.                       ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>  31.                       ├─base::withVisible(eval(expr, envir, enclos))
#>  32.                       └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  33.                         └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  34.                           ├─base::try(chk_s3_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation"))
#>  35.                           │ └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  36.                           │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_s3_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation")
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(...)
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")

# vld_s3_class
vld_s3_class(numeric(0), "numeric")
#> [1] TRUE
vld_s3_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation")
#> [1] FALSE

chk_s4_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation")

# vld_s4_class
vld_s4_class(numeric(0), "numeric")
#> [1] FALSE
vld_s4_class(getClass("MethodDefinition"), "classRepresentation")
#> [1] TRUE

# chk_whole_numeric
chk_whole_numeric(1)
try(chk_whole_numeric(1.1))
#> Error : `1.1` must be a whole numeric vector (integer vector or double equivalent).
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)

#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])

#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)

#>  11. ├─(function (what, args, quote = FALSE, envir = parent.frame()) ...
#>  12. └─(function (..., crayon_enabled, crayon_colors, pkgdown_internet) ...
#>  13.   └─pkgdown::build_site(...)

#>  22.                     └─evaluate:::evaluate_call(...)
#>  23.                       ├─evaluate:::timing_fn(...)

#>  25.                       │ └─base::try(f, silent = TRUE)

#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_whole_numeric(1.1)
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be a whole numeric vector (integer vector or double equivalent)")
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")

# vld_whole_numeric
vld_whole_numeric(1)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_whole_numeric(NA_real_)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_whole_numeric(1:2)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_whole_numeric(double(0))
#> [1] TRUE
vld_whole_numeric(TRUE)
#> [1] FALSE
vld_whole_numeric(1.5)
#> [1] FALSE

# vld_list
vld_list(list())
#> [1] TRUE
vld_list(list(x = 1))
#> [1] TRUE
vld_list(mtcars)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_list(1)
#> [1] FALSE
vld_list(NULL)
#> [1] FALSE

# chk_function
chk_function(mean)
try(chk_function(1))

# vld_function
vld_function(mean)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_function(function(x) x)
#> [1] TRUE
vld_function(1)
#> [1] FALSE
vld_function(list(1))
#> [1] FALSE

# chk_vector
chk_vector(1)
chk_vector(list())
try(chk_vector(matrix(1)))
#> Error : `matrix(1)` must be a vector.
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)

#>  22.                     └─evaluate:::evaluate_call(...)

#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_vector(matrix(1))
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be a vector")
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")

# vld_vector
vld_vector(1)
#> [1] TRUE

# chk_scalar
chk_scalar(1)
chk_scalar(list(1))
try(chk_scalar(1:2))
#> Error : `1:2` must be a scalar (length 1).
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>   3. │   ├─base:::tryCatchOne(...)
#>   4. │   │ └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   5. │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>   7. │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>   9. ├─base::saveRDS(...)
#>  10. ├─base::do.call(...)
#>  11. ├─(function (what, args, quote = FALSE, envir = parent.frame()) ...
#>  12. └─(function (..., crayon_enabled, crayon_colors, pkgdown_internet) ...
#>  13.   └─pkgdown::build_site(...)
#>  14.     └─pkgdown:::build_site_local(...)
#>  15.       └─pkgdown::build_reference(...)
#>  16.         └─purrr::map(...)
#>  17.           └─pkgdown:::.f(.x[[i]], ...)
#>  18.             └─pkgdown:::data_reference_topic(...)
#>  19.               └─pkgdown:::run_examples(...)
#>  20.                 └─pkgdown:::highlight_examples(code, topic, env = env)
#>  21.                   └─evaluate::evaluate(x, child_env(env), new_device = TRUE)
#>  22.                     └─evaluate:::evaluate_call(...)
#>  23.                       ├─evaluate:::timing_fn(...)
#>  24.                       ├─evaluate:::handle(...)
#>  25.                       │ └─base::try(f, silent = TRUE)
#>  26.                       │   └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  27.                       │     └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  28.                       │       └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  29.                       │         └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  30.                       ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>  31.                       ├─base::withVisible(eval(expr, envir, enclos))
#>  32.                       └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  33.                         └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  34.                           ├─base::try(chk_scalar(1:2))
#>  35.                           │ └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  36.                           │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_scalar(1:2)
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be a scalar (length 1)")
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")

# vld_scalar
vld_scalar(1)
#> [1] TRUE
